channel.title: HTTP 203 Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Where Paul and Jake occasionally talk web.
channel.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
channel.itunes:summary: Paul and Jake talk about whatever's going on in the world of web development.

item.title: Springy CSS, Storage, and Bisecting.
item.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul and Jake talk about physics-based animation, asking the browser for permanent storage space, and how to find where a Chrome bug was created.
item.itunes:summary: Paul has been playing with springy animations in the Safari Tech Preview, and Jake loves pubs that are also... windmills?

item.title: Promises, Mistakes, and Door Handles.
item.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul and Jake talk about how to Promisify Node, the sins of CSS, and how hard it can be to find a door handle.
item.itunes:summary: Jake's discovered display: contents, while Paul is concerned about people microbenchmarking ES2015 features.

item.title: Poetry and Delegated Event Listeners.
item.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul and Jake talk about poetry, event listeners, and content that jumps around your screen.
item.itunes:summary: Jake brings his A+ poetry game, and Paul muses over the performance implications of event delegation.

item.title: CORS, Forced Layouts, and Raptor Kebab Shops.
item.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul and Jake talk about CORS, Layout, and which of them has the evolutionary advantage.
item.itunes:summary: Why does nobody seem to include CORS headers on their files? And can Paul answer Jake's dreaded CORS pre-flight quiz?

item.title: Making Burgers and Maintainable Code.
item.itunes:author: Paul Lewis & Jake Archibald
item.itunes:subtitle: Paul and Jake talk about making burgers and maintainable code.
item.itunes:summary: How can writing code be like making a burger? Turns out, by the power of weird segues, it can!
